clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of Gut Microbiome and Chronic Inflammation in Young-onset Colorectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Gut Microbiome and Chronic Inflammation in Young-onset Colorectal Cancer: Next-generation Sequencing (NGS) as a Screening Method

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to investigate the role of gut microbiome pattern and inflammation marker NF-ҡB in young-onset colorectal cancer

primary_outcome.description: Gut microbiome examination will be conducted with next generation sequencing (NGS) method

Asia Pacific Colorectal Screening (APCS) is a validated tool to predict the risk of colorectal cancer in asymptomatic Asian population. The scoring system comprises of three categories: low risk (score 0-1), moderate risk (score 2-3) and high risk (score 4-7). Patients with moderate and high risk will undergo further examinations
Carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) is a well-known marker for colorectal cancer. A pre-treatment serum CEA level of ≥ 5 ng/mL is associated with poor prognosis in colorectal cancer patients.
NF-ҡB is a chronic inflammation marker found in colorectal cancer patients. Presence of NF-ҡB is assessed with immunohistochemical method. The result is considered positive if accumulated score ≥ 3.

Fecal immunochemical test (FIT) is a recommended screening method for colorectal cancer. Detection of hemoglobin over a certain level in fecal samples indicated a positive FIT. Patients with positive FIT will undergo further examinations

arm_group.description: Patients suspected with colorectal cancer who come to our hospital to conduct colonoscopy procedure will be recruited for this study and will undergo a series of examinations.

intervention.description: Asia Pacific Colorectal Screening (APCS) is a validated tool to predict the risk of colorectal cancer in asymptomatic Asian population. The scoring system comprises of three categories: low risk (score 0-1), moderate risk (score 2-3) and high risk (score 4-7). Patients with moderate and high risk will undergo further examinations.

Blood samples will be taken before colonoscopy procedure to evaluate the level of serum CEA by ELISA method and to evaluate the presence of NF-ҡB by immunohistochemical method. Carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) is a well-known marker for colorectal cancer. A pre-treatment serum CEA level of ≥ 5 ng/mL is associated with poor prognosis in colorectal cancer patients. NF-ҡB is a chronic inflammation marker found in colorectal cancer patients.

Fecal samples will be taken before colonoscopy procedure to be tested for FIT and to evaluate the gut microbiome. Fecal immunochemical test (FIT) is a recommended screening method for colorectal cancer. Detection of hemoglobin over a certain level in fecal samples indicated a positive FIT. Patients with positive FIT will undergo further examinations. Gut microbiome examination will be conducted with next generation sequencing (NGS) method.

study_pop.textblock: Patients suspected with colorectal cancer who come to our hospital to conduct colonoscopy procedure will be recruited for this study and will undergo a series of examinations. Since this is a pilot study to obtain gut microbiome pattern on colorectal cancer patients, the number of samples is determined by the researchers: 100 subjects for neoplasm and 50 subjects for non-neoplasm (according to histopathology report)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age ≥ 35 years old
2. Suspected with colorectal cancer and undergoing a colonoscopy procedure
3. No history of colorectal cancer treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Unwilling to provide fecal and blood sample
2. Incomplete colonoscopy procedure due to any reasons
